verses.verse: There is <WH3426> a evil <WH7451> which I have seen <WH7200> under the sun <WH8121>, and it is common <WH7227> among men <WH120>:

A man <WH376> to whom God <WH430> has given <WH5414> riches <WH6239>, wealth <WH5233>, and honor <WH3519>, so that he wants <WH2638> nothing for his soul <WH5315> of all that he desires <WH183>, yet God <WH430> gives him not power <WH7980> to eat <WH398> of it <WH376>, but a stranger eats <WH398> it <WH1892>: this is vanity, and it is a evil <WH7451> disease <WH2483>.

If a man <WH376> fathered <WH3205> a hundred <WH3967> sons <WH2421>, and lived many <WH7227> years <WH8141>, so that the days <WH3117> of his years <WH8141> be many <WH7227>, and his soul <WH5315> be not filled <WH7646> with good <WH2896>, and also that he have no burial <WH6900>; I say <WH559>, that a untimely birth <WH5309> is better than he <WH2896>.
For he comes <WH935> in with vanity <WH1892>, and departs <WH3212> in darkness <WH2822>, and his name <WH8034> shall be covered <WH3680> with darkness <WH2822>.
Moreover he has not seen <WH7200> the sun <WH8121>, nor known <WH3045> any thing <WH2088>: this has more rest <WH5183> than the other <WH2088>.
Yes <WH432>, though he live <WH2421> a thousand <WH505> years <WH8141> twice <WH6471> told <WH7200>, yet has he seen no good <WH2896>: do not all go <WH1980> to one <WH259> place <WH4725>?
All the labor <WH5999> of man <WH120> is for his mouth <WH6310>, and yet the appetite <WH5315> is not filled <WH4390>.
For what has the wise <WH2450> more <WH3148> than the fool <WH3684>? what has the poor <WH6041>, that knows <WH3045> to walk <WH1980> before the living <WH2416>?
Better <WH2896> is the sight <WH4758> of the eyes <WH5869> than the wandering <WH1980> of the desire <WH5315>: this is also vanity <WH1892> and vexation <WH7469> of spirit <WH7307>.
That which has been is named <WH7121> already <WH3528>, and it is known <WH3045> that it is man <WH120>: neither may <WH3201> he contend <WH1777> with him that is mightier than he <WH8623>.
Seeing there be <WH3426> many <WH7235> things <WH1697> that increase <WH7235> vanity <WH1892>, what is man <WH120> the better <WH3148>?

For who knows <WH3045> what is good <WH2896> for man <WH120> in this life <WH2416>, all <WH4557> the days <WH3117> of his vain <WH1892> life <WH2416> which he spends <WH6213> as a shadow <WH6738>? for who can tell <WH5046> a man <WH120> what shall be after <WH310> him under the sun <WH8121>?
